page.content: MOST WOMEN BAKED ALL THEIR OWN BREAD AND CAKES.ELECTRICITY CAME TO THE VILLAGE IN 1919. {ALMOST ALL CHILDREN WENT TO CHURCH OR {CHAPEL ON SUNDAYS.THEY WEREN'T ALLOWED {TO PLAY OUTSIDE AND SHOPS,PUBS AND {CINEMAS WERE ALL CLOSED. TRIPS TO NEATH OR SWANSEA WERE VERY FEW-THE FARE TO NEATH USED TO BE 1/6(7.5P) COMPARED WITH Â£1.80 TODAY AND MOST PEOPLE IN THE VILLAGE WOULD TRAVEL BY TRAIN AS THERE USED TO BE A RAILWAY STATION HERE. {MY NEIGHBOUR THINKS THAT LIFE IN THE {"EIGHTIES" IS BETTER THAN SIXTY YEARS {AGO BECAUSE OF BETTER LIVING {CONDITIONS BUT SHE DOES NOT LIKE THE {VANDALISM,HOOLIGANISM AND DRUG TAKING {SHE HEARS ABOUT NOW. }
